description.narrative: Significant expected developmental impact will be derived from increased access to finance to microenterprises, with a focus on agri-businesses and small farmers. Despite its contribution to the country's GDP (10.5 percent of GDP as of 2016 and 12.9 percent in 2017) and employment (29.8 percent), Kosovo's agricultural sector remains underserved by banks, due to an unfavorable production structure and high costs of assessing multiple small farmers. As a result, Agrifinancing is becoming the main domain of the MFls with at least 25 percent of loans from MFIs going to agriculture over the past 6 years. IFC's support on this project will help KRK to further strengthen its impact in this sector. The expected impact of the co-investment with GAFSP is also critical as it will help to properly price the project, making funding affordable, and consequently, on-lending to microentrepreneurs and end-users in Kosovo. Furthermore, it is anticipated that from this project there will be increased inclusiveness in the micro finance market via demonstration and replication channels

The proposed investment is an IFC senior debt investment of up to EUR6.0 million, with a Blended Finance contribution from the Private Sector Window (PSW) of the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP) to Kreditimi Rural I Kosoves LLC (KRK, or the Organization). The proposed investment will help to boost the Organizations micro and small enterprises portfolio, with at least 50 percent of the proceeds to be used for lending to agribusiness borrowers including farmers. The project fits IFCs and GAFSPs strategy by directly supporting investment in micro and small enterprises and agribusiness in Kosovo. Established as an NGO credit fund in 2000, by the Central Bank of Kosovo, and converted to a Limited Liability Company in 2004, KRK is the third largest MFI with a market share of 21 percent in Kosovo. It is headquartered in Pristina and an existing IFC client since 2015.

mailing-address.narrative: Kreditimi Rural I Kosoves, LLC Lulzim Sadrija CEO +381 38 222 345 lulzim.sadrija@krk-ks.com Str. Behije Dashi, Nr.4, Pristina http://krk-ks.com/

name.narrative: The Company is headquartered in Pristina and has 26 branches across Kosovo.
